column2: DJ, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had resisted going on meds. After struggling to control bg with diet only for a year and having poor results, I started(2000 mg) Metformin XR daily, 2 500mg tabletswith breakfast and dinner.Remarkable results, I test between 100 and 125 consistantly and am able to add back nutritious foods to my diet within reason. Some mild nausea, bloating, and gas at first but mostly gone after a week, still some belching depending on what I eat {red bell pepper is worst)Should have done this sooner!!!

column2: 65-74 Female
column9: when on this drug I saw little difference in my blood sugar. I just recently had a cat scan with contrast & had to be off this med for 48 hrs.During this 48hr period my urinary incontinance disappeared. I have stopped the med as per my Dr. and on a strict diet and I'm hoping to be off any diabetic meds forever. My icontenance was more trobeling to me. I can't tell you how happy i am not to be wearing diapers

column2: owlmom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med as GLucophage 500 XR for more than 5 years. Yes, it will give you diarrhea. When I first took it I thought - no way. Dr wanted me to take 4 daily. I decided to ease into it starting with 1/day and gradually increased up to the 4. (I take 2 after lunch and 2 at bedtime) My body became accustomed to the medication and the diarrhea is not such a problem - more of loose bowels. However, I have noticed that WHAT you eat has a great impact on this side effect.  Monitor your diet and decrease or eliminate the foods that increase the problem.

column2: zorro, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: easy use and good controll. Soon as I started taking metformin my blood sugar came into line.

column2: Midwest Grandma, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking the generic form for months and have suffered diarrhea to the point that I'm leary of going out. It strikes fast and furious. I have been recently switched to Glucophage XR 500mg 2 2 times daily and it has calmed down. Problem, insurance won't pay for it and it's too expensive to buy.

column2: southerndiva, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication makes you have diarrhea sometimes. I noticed when I switched to generics my sexual drive kicked into overdrive. I try to tell my partner its the medication. If you don't believe me read the leaflet you get from the pharmacy when you pickup your prescription. Now I understand why this drug is also given to women to aid in conception. Overall I've been able to control my sugar level and lose weight.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have found over the years experimenting with brand name vs. generic of this particular medication that the brand name controls my blood sugar significantly better and with less side effects.

column2: Female  (Patient)
column9: I had some health issues post hysterectomy and a year of terrible anemia.  My issue was a quick wieght gain during this time and all the problems that go with excess weight.  I started with high blood pressure, enlarged abdomen, anxiety, etc.  I've been taking this for about a month every other day - extended release.  It's actually making a difference and is helping me digest food, etc.  I'm not diabetic but my MD felt metabolically I was a mess and this would help.  :)  I've not had any major problems.  We shall see how things continue......

column2: tazluvcats, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have PCOS and lost a baby last year. My spouse and I have been trying to have a baby with no luck. With in 4 months of taking this I final am going to have a baby girl in sept.

column2: locksmithpro, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: WAS ON THE DRUG FOR 2 1/2 YEARS WITH NO SIDE EFFECTS, THEN BEGAN VOMITING TOO OFTEN AND DIARRHEA WVERY DAY (CARRIED BAGS TO VOMIT IN IN MY POCKET IN CASE IT WOULD HAPPEN.  DECIDED TO GET OFF THE DRUG, OPTED FOR INSULIN INJECTIONS AND LITERALLY OVER NIGHT THE SYMPTOMS DISAPPEARED.  DON'T FORGET, FELLOW DIABETICS, THAT INSULIN INJECTIONS ARE NOT AS BAD AS YOU THINK.  FOR ME, THEY ARE AN ABSOLUTE BLESSING.  NOW i FEEL BETTER THAN i HAVE IN YEARS.
Gave me diarrhea all the time.  Even the extended release.
